snippet: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues.
abstract: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues; some doctors have expressed discomfort with idea of sensitive data being used to sell drugs, even though federal law requires that any personally identifiable information be removed; database provider IMS argues that system improves dialog between drug companies and health care providers.
lead_paragraph: Vast databases of patient and doctor information being used by drug makers let them know which medications physicians are prescribing and how they compare to colleagues.

headline.seo: A Data Trove Now Guides Drug Company Pitches
headline.main: Pills Tracked From Doctor to Patient to Aid Drug Marketing
headline.print_headline: Data Trove on Doctors Guides Drug Company Pitches
